definitions.text: exquisitely fine and subtle and pleasing; susceptible to injury
examples: the delicate wing of a butterfly

definitions.text: marked by great skill especially in meticulous technique
easily broken or damaged or destroyed
examples: a kite too delicate to fly safely

definitions.text: developed with extreme delicacy and subtlety
examples: the satire touches with finespun ridicule every kind of human pretense

definitions.text: difficult to handle; requiring great tact
examples: delicate negotiations with the big powers
hesitates to be explicit on so ticklish a matter

definitions.text: of an instrument or device; capable of registering minute differences or changes precisely
examples: almost undetectable with even the most delicate instruments
